required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of BOTOX® Compared to Topiramate for the Prevention of Chronic Migraine in Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Prospective, Randomized, Open-label Study to Compare the Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of BOTOX® and Topiramate for Headache Prophylaxis in Adults With Chronic Migraine

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of prophylactic (preventative) treatment with BOTOX® (onabotulinumtoxinA) compared to topiramate in adults with chronic migraine.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 50% Decrease From Baseline in the Frequency of Headache Days
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (First 28 days from Screening) to the last 28-day period ending with Week 32
primary_outcome.description: Participants recorded their headaches in a daily e-diary. A headache day was defined as a calendar day (00:00 to 23:59) with 4 or more hours of headache and/or headache of any duration with the use of migraine-specific acute headache medication(s). The number of headache days over the 28-day period was counted. The percentage of participants with a ≥ 50% decrease in headache days in the 28-day period prior to Week 32 relative to Baseline (28-day period prior to Day 1) is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Frequency of Headache Days Per 28-day Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (First 28 days from Screening) to the last 28-day period ending with Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded their headaches in a daily e-diary. A headache day was defined as a calendar day (00:00 to 23:59) with 4 or more hours of headache and/or headache of any duration with the use of migraine-specific acute headache medication(s). The number of headache days over the 28-day period was counted. A negative change from Baseline (less headache days) indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Headache Impact Test (HIT-6) Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) to the last 28-day period ending with Week 30
secondary_outcome.description: The HIT-6 is a valid disease-targeted measure used to assess the impact of headaches, comprised of 6 items that assess pain, role functioning, social functioning, cognitive functioning, vitality, and psychological distress. A total score is created by summingacross all items, and ranges from 36 (no impact) to 78 (severe impact) reflecting a "best to worst" scoring. A negative change from Baseline (a lower score) indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 70% Decrease From Baseline in the Frequency of Headache Days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (First 28 days from Screening) to the last 28-day period ending with Week 32
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded their headaches in a daily e-diary. A headache day was defined as a calendar day (00:00 to 23:59) with 4 or more hours of headache and/or headache of any duration with the use of migraine-specific acute headache medication(s). The number of headache days over the 28-day period was counted. The percentage of participants with a ≥ 70% decrease in headache days in the 28-day period prior to Week 32 relative to Baseline (28-day period prior to Day 1) is reported.

arm_group.description: 155U onabotulinumtoxinA (BOTOX®) total dose per treatment by intramuscular injection every 12 weeks for up to 3 treatments.
Topiramate starting at a daily oral dose of 25 mg/day titrated up to a maximum dose of 100 mg/day for 36 weeks. Participants who discontinue topiramate are eligible to receive treatment with BOTOX®.

intervention.description: 155U onabotulinumtoxinA (BOTOX®) total dose per treatment by intramuscular injection every 12 weeks.
Topiramate up to a maximum oral dose of 100 mg/day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History of chronic migraine
- More than 15 headache days in a 28 day period (headaches that last more than 4 hours and/or require treatment with prescription medication).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Taking opioid-containing products for acute headache treatment more than 8 days during a 28-day period
- Previous treatment with botulinum toxin of any serotype for any reason
- Previous treatment with topiramate
- On a ketogenic diet (high in fat, low in carbohydrates)
- History of acute myopia or increased intraocular pressure
- Diagnosis of myasthenia gravis, Eaton-Lambert syndrome, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis or any other significant disease that might interfere with neuromuscular function
- Acupuncture, transcutaneous electrical stimulation (TENS), cranial traction, dental splints for headache, or injection of anesthetics/steroids in the 4 weeks prior to screening.

group.title: Topiramate/BOTOX®
group.description: Topiramate starting at a daily oral dose of 25 mg/day titrated up to a maximum dose of 100 mg/day for 36 weeks. Participants who discontinue topiramate are eligible to receive treatment with BOTOX®.

baseline.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) Set included all randomized participants.

outcome.description: Participants recorded their headaches in a daily e-diary. A headache day was defined as a calendar day (00:00 to 23:59) with 4 or more hours of headache and/or headache of any duration with the use of migraine-specific acute headache medication(s). The number of headache days over the 28-day period was counted. The percentage of participants with a ≥ 50% decrease in headache days in the 28-day period prior to Week 32 relative to Baseline (28-day period prior to Day 1) is reported.

group.title: Topiramate
group.description: Topiramate starting at a daily oral dose of 25 mg/day titrated up to a maximum dose of 100 mg/day for 36 weeks. Participants who discontinue topiramate are eligible to receive treatment with BOTOX®.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 50% Decrease From Baseline in the Frequency of Headache Days
measure.description: Participants recorded their headaches in a daily e-diary. A headache day was defined as a calendar day (00:00 to 23:59) with 4 or more hours of headache and/or headache of any duration with the use of migraine-specific acute headache medication(s). The number of headache days over the 28-day period was counted. The percentage of participants with a ≥ 50% decrease in headache days in the 28-day period prior to Week 32 relative to Baseline (28-day period prior to Day 1) is reported.
measure.population: ITT Set included all randomized participants.

analysis.p_value_desc: Odds ratio, 95% CI, and p-value were estimated using a logistic regression model adjusted by baseline headache days.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Frequency of Headache Days Per 28-day Period
outcome.description: Participants recorded their headaches in a daily e-diary. A headache day was defined as a calendar day (00:00 to 23:59) with 4 or more hours of headache and/or headache of any duration with the use of migraine-specific acute headache medication(s). The number of headache days over the 28-day period was counted. A negative change from Baseline (less headache days) indicates improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (First 28 days from Screening) to the last 28-day period ending with Week 32
outcome.population: ITT Set included all randomized participants.

group.title: BOTOX®
group.description: 155U onabotulinumtoxinA (BOTOX®) total dose per treatment by intramuscular injection every 12 weeks for up to 3 treatments.

group.title: Topiramate
group.description: Topiramate starting at a daily oral dose of 25 mg/day titrated up to a maximum dose of 100 mg/day for 36 weeks. Participants who discontinue topiramate are eligible to receive treatment with BOTOX®.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Frequency of Headache Days Per 28-day Period
measure.description: Participants recorded their headaches in a daily e-diary. A headache day was defined as a calendar day (00:00 to 23:59) with 4 or more hours of headache and/or headache of any duration with the use of migraine-specific acute headache medication(s). The number of headache days over the 28-day period was counted. A negative change from Baseline (less headache days) indicates improvement.
measure.population: ITT Set included all randomized participants.

analysis.p_value_desc: Estimated mean difference, 95% CI, and p-value were assessed using analysis of covariance adjusting for baseline headache days.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Headache Impact Test (HIT-6) Total Score
outcome.description: The HIT-6 is a valid disease-targeted measure used to assess the impact of headaches, comprised of 6 items that assess pain, role functioning, social functioning, cognitive functioning, vitality, and psychological distress. A total score is created by summingacross all items, and ranges from 36 (no impact) to 78 (severe impact) reflecting a "best to worst" scoring. A negative change from Baseline (a lower score) indicates improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) to the last 28-day period ending with Week 30
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT Set, all randomized participants, with data available for analysis.

group.title: BOTOX®
group.description: 155U onabotulinumtoxinA (BOTOX®) total dose per treatment by intramuscular injection every 12 weeks for up to 3 treatments.

group.title: Topiramate
group.description: Topiramate starting at a daily oral dose of 25 mg/day titrated up to a maximum dose of 100 mg/day for 36 weeks. Participants who discontinue topiramate are eligible to receive treatment with BOTOX®.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Headache Impact Test (HIT-6) Total Score
measure.description: The HIT-6 is a valid disease-targeted measure used to assess the impact of headaches, comprised of 6 items that assess pain, role functioning, social functioning, cognitive functioning, vitality, and psychological distress. A total score is created by summingacross all items, and ranges from 36 (no impact) to 78 (severe impact) reflecting a "best to worst" scoring. A negative change from Baseline (a lower score) indicates improvement.
measure.population: Participants from the ITT Set, all randomized participants, with data available for analysis.

analysis.p_value_desc: Estimated mean difference, 95% CI, and p-value for Week 30 were assessed using analysis of covariance adjusting for baseline headache days.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 70% Decrease From Baseline in the Frequency of Headache Days
outcome.description: Participants recorded their headaches in a daily e-diary. A headache day was defined as a calendar day (00:00 to 23:59) with 4 or more hours of headache and/or headache of any duration with the use of migraine-specific acute headache medication(s). The number of headache days over the 28-day period was counted. The percentage of participants with a ≥ 70% decrease in headache days in the 28-day period prior to Week 32 relative to Baseline (28-day period prior to Day 1) is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (First 28 days from Screening) to the last 28-day period ending with Week 32
outcome.population: ITT Set included all randomized participants.

group.title: BOTOX®
group.description: 155U onabotulinumtoxinA (BOTOX®) total dose per treatment by intramuscular injection every 12 weeks for up to 3 treatments.

group.title: Topiramate
group.description: Topiramate starting at a daily oral dose of 25 mg/day titrated up to a maximum dose of 100 mg/day for 36 weeks. Participants who discontinue topiramate are eligible to receive treatment with BOTOX®.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a ≥ 70% Decrease From Baseline in the Frequency of Headache Days
measure.description: Participants recorded their headaches in a daily e-diary. A headache day was defined as a calendar day (00:00 to 23:59) with 4 or more hours of headache and/or headache of any duration with the use of migraine-specific acute headache medication(s). The number of headache days over the 28-day period was counted. The percentage of participants with a ≥ 70% decrease in headache days in the 28-day period prior to Week 32 relative to Baseline (28-day period prior to Day 1) is reported.
measure.population: ITT Set included all randomized participants.

analysis.p_value_desc: Odds ratio, 95% CI, and p-value for the Week 29-32 interval were estimated using a logistic regression model adjusted by baseline headache days.

reported_events.time_frame: First dose of study drug to the final visit (Up to 48 Weeks)
reported_events.desc: Adverse Events (AEs) were counted in the treatment group based on investigator's determination. If investigators determined AE was related to both treatments or relatedness was unknown, it was counted in both treatment groups, but only once for the total population.

group.title: BOTOX®
group.description: 155U onabotulinumtoxinA (BOTOX®) total dose per treatment by intramuscular injection every 12 weeks for up to 3 treatments. The 80 participants originally treated with topiramate who then received BOTOX® are included in this arm.

group.title: Topiramate
group.description: Topiramate starting at a daily oral dose of 25 mg/day titrated up to a maximum dose of 100 mg/day for 36 weeks.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
